bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
In the matter of the Application of K. Gregory at al., for a writ of Habeas Corpus.

Know all men by these presents: That we Jakob Ephimoff, as principal and Samuel H. Weber , residing at 1509 E. Spruce Street, in the City of Seattle, Washington, and B. Helfand residing at 1112 Broadway Court, Seattle, Washington, as sureties are held and firmly bound into the United States of America in the full sum of Two Hundred and ($250.00) Dollars to be paid to the United States, for which payment well and truly made, we, and each of us, do bind ourselves, our heirs executors, and anministrators, jointly and severally, frimly by these presents.
Sealed with our seals this 24th day of February, 1914.

WHEREAS: Jakob Ephimoff on alien, a native of Russia, who arrived at the Port of Seattle, on the day of Dec 1913 has been held by the Immigration Board for deportation and whereas, the Board ordered the said alien to be deported, and WHEREAS: the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, discharegd the said alien on a WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS and WHEREAS: THE Court ordered the said alien be enlarged upon recognizance with surety, for appearnce to answer judgment of the Appelate Court, Now, THEREFORE, the condition of this obligation is such that if the above named principal J Ephimoff appears to answer and carry out the Judgment of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit of the Appellate COurt, then this obligation to be void, otherwise to remain in full force and effect
Signed and sealed in the present of
